member.summary: Identifies the type of class interface that is generated for a class.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterfaceType.AutoDispatch
member.summary: Indicates that the class only supports late binding for COM clients. A dispinterface for the class is automatically exposed to COM clients on request. The type library produced by Tlbexp.exe (Type Library Exporter) does not contain type information for the dispinterface in order to prevent clients from caching the DISPIDs of the interface. The dispinterface does not exhibit the versioning problems described in because clients can only late-bind to the interface.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterfaceType.AutoDual
member.summary: Indicates that a dual class interface is automatically generated for the class and exposed to COM. Type information is produced for the class interface and published in the type library. Using AutoDual is strongly discouraged because of the versioning limitations described in .

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterfaceType.None
member.summary: Indicates that no class interface is generated for the class. If no interfaces are implemented explicitly, the class can only provide late-bound access through the IDispatch interface. This is the recommended setting for . Using ClassInterfaceType.None is the only way to expose functionality through interfaces implemented explicitly by the class.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.GCHandleType
member.summary: Represents the types of handles the class can allocate.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.GCHandleType.Normal
member.summary: This handle type represents an opaque handle, meaning you cannot resolve the address of the pinned object through the handle. You can use this type to track an object and prevent its collection by the garbage collector. This enumeration member is useful when an unmanaged client holds the only reference, which is undetectable from the garbage collector, to a managed object.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.GCHandleType.Pinned
member.summary: This handle type is similar to , but allows the address of the pinned object to be taken. This prevents the garbage collector from moving the object and hence undermines the efficiency of the garbage collector. Use the method to free the allocated handle as soon as possible.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.GCHandleType.Weak
member.summary: This handle type is used to track an object, but allow it to be collected. When an object is collected, the contents of the are zeroed. Weak references are zeroed before the finalizer runs, so even if the finalizer resurrects the object, the Weak reference is still zeroed.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.GCHandleType.WeakTrackResurrection
member.summary: This handle type is similar to , but the handle is not zeroed if the object is resurrected during finalization.

A hash value to speed up the search, computed by the LHashValOfNameSys function. If is 0, a value is computed.

An array of the MEMBERID 's of the found items; [i] is the MEMBERID that indexes into the type description specified by [i]. Cannot be null.

On entry, indicates how many instances to look for. For example, = 1 can be called to find the first occurrence. The search stops when one instance is found.On exit, indicates the number of instances that were found. If the in and out values of are identical, there might be more type descriptions that contain the name.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.SYSKIND
member.summary: Identifies the target operating system platform.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.SYSKIND.SYS_MAC
member.summary: The target operating system for the type library is Apple Macintosh. By default, all data fields are aligned on even-byte boundaries.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.SYSKIND.SYS_WIN16
member.summary: The target operating system for the type library is 16-bit Windows systems. By default, data fields are packed.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.SYSKIND.SYS_WIN32
member.summary: The target operating system for the type library is 32-bit Windows systems. By default, data fields are naturally aligned (for example, 2-byte integers are aligned on even-byte boundaries; 4-byte integers are aligned on quad-word boundaries, and so on).

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.SYSKIND.SYS_WIN64
member.summary: The target operating system for the type library is 64-bit Windows systems.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYMED
member.summary: Provides the managed definition of the TYMED structure.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYMED.TYMED_ENHMF
member.summary: The storage medium is an enhanced metafile. If the member is null, the destination process should use DeleteEnhMetaFile to delete the bitmap.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYMED.TYMED_FILE
member.summary: The storage medium is a disk file identified by a path. If the STGMEDIUM member is null, the destination process should use OpenFile to delete the file.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYMED.TYMED_GDI
member.summary: The storage medium is a Graphics Device Interface (GDI) component (HBITMAP). If the member is null, the destination process should use DeleteObject to delete the bitmap.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYMED.TYMED_HGLOBAL
member.summary: The storage medium is a global memory handle (HGLOBAL). Allocate the global handle with the GMEM_SHARE flag. If the member is null, the destination process should use GlobalFree to release the memory.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYMED.TYMED_ISTORAGE
member.summary: The storage medium is a storage component identified by an IStorage pointer. The data is in the streams and storages contained by this IStorage instance. If the member is not null, the destination process should use IStorage::Release to release the storage component.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYMED.TYMED_ISTREAM
member.summary: The storage medium is a stream object identified by an IStream pointer. Use ISequentialStream::Read to read the data. If the member is not null, the destination process should use IStream::Release to release the stream component.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYMED.TYMED_MFPICT
member.summary: The storage medium is a metafile (HMETAFILE). Use the Windows or WIN32 functions to access the metafile's data. If the member is null, the destination process should use DeleteMetaFile to delete the bitmap.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYMED.TYMED_NULL
member.summary: No data is being passed.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FAGGREGATABLE
member.summary: The class supports aggregation.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FAPPOBJECT
member.summary: A type description that describes an Application object.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FCANCREATE
member.summary: Instances of the type can be created by ITypeInfo::CreateInstance.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FCONTROL
member.summary: The type is a control from which other types will be derived and should not be displayed to users.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FDISPATCHABLE
member.summary: Indicates that the interface derives from IDispatch, either directly or indirectly. This flag is computed; there is no Object Description Language for the flag.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FDUAL
member.summary: The interface supplies both IDispatch and VTBL binding.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FHIDDEN
member.summary: The type should not be displayed to browsers.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FLICENSED
member.summary: The type is licensed.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FNONEXTENSIBLE
member.summary: The interface cannot add members at run time.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FOLEAUTOMATION
member.summary: The types used in the interface are fully compatible with Automation, including VTBL binding support. Setting dual on an interface sets both this flag and the . This flag is not allowed on dispinterfaces.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FPREDECLID
member.summary: The type is predefined. The client application should automatically create a single instance of the object that has this attribute. The name of the variable that points to the object is the same as the class name of the object.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FPROXY
member.summary: Indicates that the interface will be using a proxy/stub dynamic link library. This flag specifies that the type library proxy should not be unregistered when the type library is unregistered.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FREPLACEABLE
member.summary: The object supports IConnectionPointWithDefault, and has default behaviors.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FRESTRICTED
member.summary: Should not be accessible from macro languages. This flag is intended for system-level types or types that type browsers should not display.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FREVERSEBIND
member.summary: Indicates base interfaces should be checked for name resolution before checking children, which is the reverse of the default behavior.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEKIND
member.summary: Specifies various types of data and functions.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEKIND.TKIND_ALIAS
member.summary: A type that is an alias for another type.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEKIND.TKIND_COCLASS
member.summary: A set of implemented components interfaces.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEKIND.TKIND_DISPATCH
member.summary: A set of methods and properties that are accessible through IDispatch::Invoke. By default, dual interfaces return TKIND_DISPATCH.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEKIND.TKIND_ENUM
member.summary: A set of enumerators.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEKIND.TKIND_INTERFACE
member.summary: A type that has virtual functions, all of which are pure.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEKIND.TKIND_MAX
member.summary: End-of-enumeration marker.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEKIND.TKIND_MODULE
member.summary: A module that can have only static functions and data (for example, a DLL).

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEKIND.TKIND_RECORD
member.summary: A structure with no methods.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPEKIND.TKIND_UNION
member.summary: A union of all members that have an offset of zero.

member.summary: Identifies a particular type library and provides localization support for member names.

member.summary: Represents a globally unique library ID of a type library.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPELIBATTR.lcid
member.summary: Represents a locale ID of a type library.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPELIBATTR.syskind
member.summary: Represents the target hardware platform of a type library.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPELIBATTR.wLibFlags
member.summary: Represents library flags.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPELIBATTR.wMajorVerNum
member.summary: Represents the major version number of a type library.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.TYPELIBATTR.wMinorVerNum
member.summary: Represents the minor version number of a type library.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARDESC.lpstrSchema

member.summary: Contains information about a variable.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARDESC.DESCUNION.lpvarValue
member.summary: Describes a symbolic constant.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARDESC.DESCUNION.oInst
member.summary: Indicates the offset of this variable within the instance.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARFLAGS
member.summary: Identifies the constants that define the properties of a variable.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FBINDABLE
member.summary: The variable supports data binding.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FDEFAULTBIND
member.summary: The variable is the single property that best represents the object. Only one variable in type information can have this attribute.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FDEFAULTCOLLELEM
member.summary: Permits an optimization in which the compiler looks for a member named "xyz" on the type of "abc". If such a member is found and is flagged as an accessor function for an element of the default collection, then a call is generated to that member function. Permitted on members in dispinterfaces and interfaces; not permitted on modules.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FDISPLAYBIND
member.summary: The variable is displayed to the user as bindable. must also be set.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FHIDDEN
member.summary: The variable should not be displayed to the user in a browser, although it exists and is bindable.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FIMMEDIATEBIND
member.summary: The variable is mapped as individual bindable properties.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FNONBROWSABLE
member.summary: The variable appears in an object browser, but not in a properties browser.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FREADONLY
member.summary: Assignment to the variable should not be allowed.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FREPLACEABLE
member.summary: Tags the interface as having default behaviors.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FREQUESTEDIT
member.summary: When set, any attempt to directly change the property results in a call to IPropertyNotifySink::OnRequestEdit. The implementation of OnRequestEdit determines if the change is accepted.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FRESTRICTED
member.summary: The variable should not be accessible from macro languages. This flag is intended for system-level variables or variables that you do not want type browsers to display.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FSOURCE
member.summary: The variable returns an object that is a source of events.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARFLAGS.VARFLAG_FUIDEFAULT
member.summary: The variable is the default display in the user interface.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARKIND
member.summary: Defines the kind of variable.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARKIND.VAR_CONST
member.summary: The VARDESC structure describes a symbolic constant. There is no memory associated with it.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARKIND.VAR_DISPATCH
member.summary: The variable can be accessed only through IDispatch::Invoke.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARKIND.VAR_PERINSTANCE
member.summary: The variable is a field or member of the type. It exists at a fixed offset within each instance of the type.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.VARKIND.VAR_STATIC
member.summary: There is only one instance of the variable.
